Package edu.ntnu.idatt1002.backend.budgeting

Class Expense

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idatt1002.backend.budgeting.Expense
public class Expense extends Object
A class that represents an expense. An expense has a name, a price, a category and a date.
Version:
1.0 - 26.04.2023
Author:
Emil J., Vegard J., Sander S. and Elias T.

  • Constructor Details

    • Expense

      public Expense()
      Private constructor to avoid multiple instances of the class.

    • Expense

      public Expense(String name, double price, int category, LocalDate date)
      Constructor for the class.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the expense.
      price - the price of the expense.
      category - the category of the expense.
      date - the date of the expense.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the name is null or empty.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the price is negative or the category is not between 1 and 6.

    • Expense

      public Expense(String name, Double price, LocalDate date, String category, String account)
      Constructor for the class.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the expense.
      price - the price of the expense.
      date - the date of the expense.
      category - the category of the expense.
      account - the account
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the name is null or empty.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the price is negative or the category is not between 1 and 6.

    • Expense

      public Expense(String name, Double price, LocalDate date, String category, String account, String uniqueId)
      Constructor for the class.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the expense.
      price - the price of the expense.
      date - the date of the expense.
      category - the category of the expense.
      account - the account
      uniqueId - the uniqueID of the expense.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the name is null or empty.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the price is negative or the category is not between 1 and 6.
